shit.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: used to express anger, annoyance, fear, or disappointment
shit.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Shit! I’ve left my purse at home.
shit.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: solid waste that comes out of your body from your bowels
shit.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: a car covered in bird shit
shit.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: an act of getting rid of solid waste from your bowels
take a shit (also have a shit British English)
shit.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: something that you think is bad or of very bad quality, or a bad situation
shit.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: something that someone says that you think is stupid or untrue
shit.translation[1].definitions[3].examp: You expect me to believe that shit?
You’re full of shit  (=the things you say are stupid or untrue).
shit.translation[1].definitions[4].defin: an insulting word for someone who is very unpleasant and treats other people badly. Do not use this word.
shit.translation[1].definitions[5].defin: someone’s possessions, especially the things they have with them
shit.translation[1].definitions[5].examp: Get your shit together, then come on over.
shit.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: to pass solid waste out of your body from your bowels
shit.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: to tell someone something that is untrue
shit.translation[2].definitions[2].examp: This will teach you not to shit on me.
